author: Kate McCann
title: Boris Johnson to launch new 'soft power' fund to combat Russian and Islamic extremism abroad
text:
Boris Johnson to launch new 'soft power' fund to combat Russian and Islamic extremism abroad Vladimir Putin Credit: AP Kate McCann , Senior Political Correspondent 13 February 2017 • 8:14am 
T he foreign aid budget is to be spent on strengthening British allies abroad against Russia as part of a plan set out by Boris Johnson, according to reports. 
The foreign secretary has earmarked £700million of the £12billion aid budget to create a new Empowerment Fund which will be used as a "soft" weapon against Vladimir Putin. 
The Sun newspaper revealed the money will be spent on projects to boost the UK's interests abroad by helping allies like the Baltic states counter the effects of Russian and Islamic State power. Boris Johnson Credit: Getty 
T he money will not be spent on weapons but instead will combat extremism, particularly cyber warfare. 
Mr Johnson is reportedly behind the new fund, which follows intense criticism of the way the British aid budget is spent. 
In December the foreign secretary said: ""We have the cult of the strong man. We have democracy in retreat. 
"We need to redouble our resolve and defend and preserve the best of the rules based international order." Priti Patel is the aid secretary Credit: Andrew Parsons 

T he scheme is seen as a way to help boost the UK's global influence in the wake of Brexit, a Whitehall source told the newspaper. 
The Foreign Office did not comment on the report. Follow Telegraph News
